alert.note: Alert for City of Newport News; City of Williamsburg; Gloucester; Isle of Wight; James City; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 17 at 8:44PM EDT until August 17 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Gloucester County in eastern Virginia... North central Isle of Wight County in southeastern Virginia... Northwestern York County in southeastern Virginia... The northern City of Newport News in southeastern Virginia... Central James City County in southeastern Virginia... Northeastern Surry County in southeastern Virginia... The City of Williamsburg in southeastern Virginia... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 844 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Scotland, or near Surry, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Jamestown, Kings Point, York Terrace, Carver Gardens, and Busch Gardens around 850 PM EDT. Queens Lake and Grove around 855 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Rushmere, Croaker, Lackey, Chippokes State Park, Camp Peary, Glass, Ewell, Poolesville, Allmondsville, and Hog Island Game Reserve. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: City of Newport News; City of Williamsburg; Gloucester; Isle of Wight; James City; Surry; York
